item.description: Derivative of inverse and singular values # Derivative of inverse # Given matrix $ \mathcal{A(t)} $, how does it relate to $ \mathcal{ A^{-1}(t) } $, in detail: Given $ \frac{d(A)}{dt} $, find $ \frac{d(A^{-1})}{dt} $ Let start with, $ B^{-1} - A^{-1} = B^{-1}(A - B)A^{-1} $ Which mean $ B^{-1} - A^{-1} $ and $ A - B $ has the same rank (because $ B^{-1}, A^{-1}, A, B $ is invertible (has full rank)).
